content: The Act may be cited as the "No Child Left Behind Improvement Act of 2005" and includes amendments to ESEA. The "No Child Left Behind Improvement Act of 2005" amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 regarding the qualifications of middle school teachers. Teachers must have successful completion of an academic major, a graduate degree, or equivalent coursework in the subject they teach.
